III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/2/25, a youth was physically aggressive with a staff member
who responded with deflecting with their forearms. The youth
reports that the staff member hit them in the face with their hand.
There is a red spot on the youth's face and the exact cause is
unknown.
Investigation Interviews:
Program Manager was interviewed via telephone on April 3,
2025. Program Manager said she received information from
Medical Staff Z who was present during the incident. Program
Manager said Medical Staff Z reported she was unsure if Staff 1
made contact with Youth A’s face due to the angle at which she
was standing. Program Manager said the incident took place in a
doorway near the medical office which is out of camera view.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 7,
2025. Youth A said he was not able to remember what Staff 1 was
doing but knows he did not like it, so Youth A started to punch her
and pull her hair. Youth A said Staff 1 was trying to get him to let
go of her hair and hit him in the face on his left cheek. Youth A
said he then calmed down and went back to his unit. Youth A said
he had a bruise on his cheek from Staff 1. Youth A said Staff 2 and
Medical Staff X were present during the situation with no other
youth around. Youth A said this occurred in the doorway of the
family game room. At that time Youth A said he did not want to talk
anymore and left the room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 7,
2025. Staff 1 said she has worked with Youth A previously but is a
floater staff so is not consistently on his unit. Staff 1 said Youth A
was moved to her unit the day of the incident due to being in a
physical altercation with another youth on his unit. Staff 1 said
Youth A repeatedly was walking off the unit trying to go back to his
own unit and she was following him on and off the unit several
times. Staff 1 said Youth A walked off the unit and was looking in
his unit and saw a peer touching his belongings which made him
very upset. Staff 1 said Youth A then walked off the unit and over
to the medical office and began to hit and kick the window and
door. Staff 1 said Medical Staff Z came out of the office and
redirected Youth A to stop because there was a new hire training
in the family game room. Staff 1 said Youth A then walked towards
the family game room and she followed and stood in front of the
2

door to prevent him from getting into the room and he began to hit
and kick her. Staff 1 said she used a “deflective swing” from her
training to prevent Youth A from hitting her. Youth A grabbed her
hair and began to pull. Staff 1’s hair length is down to her
waistline; she reported Youth A had her hair at about halfway
down her back. Staff 1 said she was attempting to use the
“release from hair pulls” from her training by taking hold of his
hand with her closed hand and pull it towards her. Staff 1 said
Staff 2 was able to assist her and get Youth A’s hands out of her
hair. Staff 1 said once Youth A’s hands were out of her hair, he
began to start punching her again and she once again used the
“deflective swing” from training. Staff 1 said Youth A suddenly
made the comment that she had hit him and stopped being
aggressive. Staff 1 said she does not believe she made contact
with Youth A’s face and if she did it was not intentional but rather
when she was deflecting his punches. Staff 1 said she stepped
back and Staff 2 stepped in and walked Youth A back to his unit.
Staff 1 said she never saw any marks on Youth A’s face. Staff 1
said Youth A is often easily frustrated and frequently assaults staff.
Staff 1 said Medical Staff Z was in the hallway with her, Staff 2,
and Youth A however was not assisting during the incident. Staff 1
said she would never hit a youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 7,
2025. Staff 2 said Youth A was upset and walked off his unit and
was attempting to get into the family game room where many staff
were participating in a training session. Staff 2 said Staff 1 was
standing by Youth A talking with him and he grabbed Staff 1’s hair
and was pulling. Staff 2 said he and Staff 1 worked on getting
Youth A’s hands out of Staff 1’s hair and after about a minute
Youth A let go and went back to the unit. Staff 2 said during the
incident Youth A was yelling but he never heard him say Staff 1
had hit him. Staff 2 said Medical Staff Z was also present for the
incident but was unsure of where she was standing. Staff 2 said
he never saw Staff 1 hit or swing her arm or hand near Youth A’s
face. Staff 2 said he did not see any marks or bruises on Youth A.
Staff 2 said Youth A is commonly unpredictable and assaults staff
“often”. Staff 2 said he has never seen Staff 1 be aggressive with
the youth and “all the kids love her”.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 7,
2025. Staff 3 denied being present during the incident with Youth A
and Staff 1. Staff 3 reported he has never seen Staff 1 hit Youth A
or any other youth. Staff 3 said Staff 1 is “always doing a lot for the
kids” and is a “great staff”. Staff 3 said Youth A is unpredictable
and impulsive and is known to be assaultive towards staff.
3

Medical Staff Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 7, 2025. Medical Staff Z said she was working in the medical
office when Youth A began banging and yelling at the door.
Medical Staff Z said she went out of the office to talk with Youth A
in the hallway and he walked over to the family game room and
began to bang on that door where a training was taking place.
Medical Staff Z said Staff 1 redirected Youth A to move away from
the door and he lunged at Staff 1 swinging his arms and grabbed
ahold of her hair. Medical Staff Z said she saw Staff 1 swing her
arm at Youth A with what appeared to be a closed fist and then
heard Youth A say, “you fucking hit me”. Medical Staff Z said Youth
A let go of Staff 1’s hair and went back to his unit. Medical Staff Z
said she originally felt unsure if she saw Staff 1 make contact with
Youth A however now feels confident that Staff 1 made contact
with Youth A’s face however is unsure if it was intentional. Medical
Staff Z said Medical Staff Y went to the unit and took pictures of
Youth A’s face. Medical Staff Z said she does not work on the units
so does not see Staff 1 interact with the youth. Medical Staff Z
said she has never heard of Staff 1 being aggressive previously.
Medical Staff Z denied Medical Staff X being involved or present
during the incident.
Medical Staff Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 7, 2025. Medical Staff Y said she was not present for the
incident however was told to go to Youth A’s unit to take
photographs of his face. Medical Staff Y said Youth A did not have
any cuts or bruises on his face, noting some redness. Medical
Staff Y said she asked Youth A what happened, and he said that
Staff 1 hit him in the face.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of April 2, 2025, in the hallway outside of the
nurse’s office was reviewed on April 7, 2025. Youth A walks to
the nurse’s office window and is pounding and kicking. Medical
Staff Z comes out of the nurse’s office and Youth A walks down the
hallway with Staff 1 and Staff 2 following him closely and Medical
Staff Z following several steps behind. At this point there is no
camera view of what happens in the doorway.
Documents Reviewed:
• Photographs of Youth A were reviewed on April 7, 2025.
The photographs showed slight redness on both sides of
Youth A’s face, there was no clear sign of a welt, bruise, or
cut.
4

• Incident Report written by Staff 2 dated April 2, 2025, was
consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Incident Report written by Staff 1 dated April 2, 2025, was
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was discipline on August 6,
2021, for failure to complete required training; September
7, 2021, for failure to complete required training; May 9,
2022, for inappropriate conversation with youth which
consisted of sharing that she was going to call into work
with a “fake note”; and June 21, 2024, for allowing youth to
listen to “non-approved music”. Staff 1 completed her TCI
training on March 21, 2025.
• Whaley Children’s Center Physical Intervention Policy was
reviewed. The policy prohibits staff from “hitting or striking”
youth and requires staff to utilize Therapeutic Crisis
Management (TCI) techniques during any physical
intervention with youth.
• Therapeutic Crisis Management (TCI) restraint skills
curriculum was reviewed for “Release from Hair Pulls” and
“Deflecting a Swing”.
o Release from hair pulls is described as staff taking
advantage of the weakness in the youth’s grasp at
their knuckles by pressing on the youth’s knuckles
and raking the youth’s hand away.
o Deflecting a swing is described as a staff raising his
arm towards the ceiling and deflecting the swing
away using the forearm with the open hand.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as Staff 1 and Staff 2 denied
Staff 1 hitting Youth A; Youth A said Staff 1 hit him; and Medical
Staff Z at first said she was unsure then said she was sure but not
sure of the intent. There was no video and no marks on Youth A
following the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
